hanzi-su-wiki:
赴

Значения

Направляться куда-либо

Мнемоника

Гадать 卜, будет ли удача, идти 走 ли туда, куда задумано.
purpleculture_pinyin:
fù
to go; to visit (e.g. another country); to attend (a banquet etc)
идти; посетить (например, другую страну); присутствовать (банкет и т. д.)
rtega_mnemonic:
赴赴RSgo to, attend, be present
  • go 走 to the fortunetelling 卜 ceremony
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 卜 indicates the sound; 走 (walk) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
奔赴 [ bēn fù ]: to rush to; to hurry to
全力以赴 [ quán lì yǐ fù ]: to do at all costs; to make an all-out effort
赶赴 [ gǎn fù ]: to hurry; to rush
开赴 [ kāi fù ]: (of troops) to depart for; to head for
前赴后继 [ qián fù hòu jì ]: to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 走 [ zǒu ] to walk, to run, to flee
    • 卜 [ bo ] divination, fortune-telling; prophecy
heisig_keyword: proceed | направляться куда-то (по путеводителю), продолжить идти
heisig_chinese_memo: Don't run into trouble, just walk slowly Dumbledore tells Harry. "Go to Hagrid and proceed with caution with your magic wand out.".
heisig_constituent: proceed, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, magic wand, augury
heisig_story: In proceeding to a new city or a new job, something in you runs ahead with excitement, and something else holds you back, like a divining rod built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly.
koohiiStory1: Don´t run into trouble, Dumbledore tells Harry. "Proceed with caution with your wand out.".
koohiiStory2: While running, my magic wand tells me where to proceed.
jp_example_words:
赴く(おもむく): to go, to proceed, to repair to, to become
赴任(ふにん): (proceeding to) new appointment
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You need to run on your toes if you want to proceed down this road. If you can't run on your toes, well then you're out of luck, and you won't be able to move on at all. I didn't make this rule, I just enforce it. Now run!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine trying to proceed down the road by running on your toes. No other part of your foot can touch the ground!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you find that you can't proceed, you're a fool (ふ). Everyone can run on their toes. Don't you know that? No? Then you're an even bigger fool, now get outta here!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine being called a fool when you can't proceed along the road because running on your toes ends up being super hard to do.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: you run (走) with your divining rod (卜) to proceed towards
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Don't run into trouble, just walk slowly Dumbledore tells Harry. "Go to Hagrid and proceed with caution with your magic wand out.".
humanum_full_description_en:
From " go " to " servant ", the original meaning is to go and go. "Shuowen": "Tend to also. Go from there, and punk the voice." "Historical Records-Funny Biographies": "If you want to go to Tuo country and die, it hurts my two masters to make it impossible."

" Going " can mean devotion or jump in. "Songs of the Chu-Fisherman": "Ning went to Xiangliu and was buried in the belly of Jiangyu."

" Going " also means devotion and participation. "Book of Jin-Wei Guan Biography": "If you come to the official army, you will be rewarded as first; if you dare to fail, you will kill the three clans."

" Going " also means meeting and conforming. Jin Luji "Imitated Dongcheng Yihe Gao": "The sound of the piano is played at leisure in the night, the sound is clear and sorrowful. The long song goes to the festival, and the sorrow swells the emblem."

" Going " also means attachment. Tang Hanyu "Xianzhai Youhuai": "Daliang Congxianggong, Pengcheng went to shoot."
humanum_short_description_en: from " go ", " servant " to save the sound, the original meaning is to go, go.
humanum_full_description:
從「走」，「仆」省聲，本義為趨走、前往。《說文》：「趨也。从走，仆省聲。」《史記‧滑稽列傳》：「欲赴佗國奔亡，痛吾兩主使不通。」

　　「赴」可表示投入、跳進。《楚辭‧漁父》：「寧赴湘流，葬入江魚之腹中。」

　　「赴」也表示投身、參與。《晉書‧衛瓘傳》：「若來赴官軍，爵賞如先；敢有不出，誅及三族。」

　　「赴」還表示應合、順應。晉陸機〈擬東城一何高〉：「閑夜撫鳴琴，惠音清且悲。長歌赴促節，哀響逐高徽。」

　　「赴」亦表示依附。唐韓愈〈縣齋有懷〉：「大梁從相公，彭城赴僕射。」
humanum_short_description: 從「走」，「仆」省聲，本義為趨走、前往。

赴く(おもむく): to go, to proceed, to repair to, to become
赴任(ふにん): (proceeding to) new appointment

從「 走 」，「 仆 」省聲，本義為趨走、前往。《說文》：「趨也。从走，仆省聲。」《史記‧滑稽列傳》：「欲赴佗國奔亡，痛吾兩主使不通。」 「 赴 」可表示投入、跳進。《楚辭‧漁父》：「寧赴湘流，葬入江魚之腹中。」 「 赴 」也表示投身、參與。《晉書‧衛瓘傳》：「若來赴官軍，爵賞如先；敢有不出，誅及三族。」 「 赴 」還表示應合、順應。晉陸機〈擬東城一何高〉：「閑夜撫鳴琴，惠音清且悲。長歌赴促節，哀響逐高徽。」 「 赴 」亦表示依附。唐韓愈〈縣齋有懷〉：「大梁從相公，彭城赴僕射。」
From " go" to " servant", the original meaning is to go and go. "Shuowen": "Tend to also. Go from there, and punk the voice." "Historical Records-Funny Biographies": "If you want to go to Tuo country and die, it hurts my two masters to make it impossible." " Going" can mean devotion or jump in. "Songs of the Chu-Fisherman": "Ning went to Xiangliu and was buried in the belly of Jiangyu." " Going" also means devotion and participation. "Book of Jin-Wei Guan Biography": "If you come to the official army, you will be rewarded as first; if you dare to fail, you will kill the three clans." " Going" also means meeting and conforming. Jin Luji "Imitated Dongcheng Yihe Gao": "The sound of the piano is played at leisure in the night, the sound is clear and sorrowful. The long song goes to the festival, and the sorrow swells the emblem." " Going" also means attachment. Tang Hanyu "Xianzhai Youhuai": "Daliang Congxianggong, Pengcheng went to shoot."

赴字的基本解释

赴
fù
往，去：赴京。赴会。赴任。赴约。赴宴。
投入（某种境地），参加（某种行列）：赴战。赴敌（加入对敌作战）。赴难（n刵 ）。赴义。
古同“讣”，讣告。

赴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fù］
［《廣韻》芳遇切，去遇，敷。］
“報2”的被通假字。
(1)到；去；前往。
(2)急速。
(3)投入；跳进。
(4)投身；参与。
(5)奔集。
(6)应合；顺应。
(7)依附。
(8)往救。
(9)冒着。
(10)泅；游泳。
(11)后多作“訃”。讣告，报丧。
(12)谓奔丧。

赴字的英文翻译

◎ 赴
attend, betake, go to

赴字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【走字部】　赴； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页1215第08
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?芳遇切，音仆。【爾雅·釋詁】赴，至也。【疏】趨而至也。【說文】趨也。【註】徐鉉曰：《春秋傳》赴告用此字，今俗作訃，非是。【左傳·隱三年】赴以庚戌。　又【韻補】叶直祜切。【傅咸·燕賦】逮來春而復旋，意眷眷而懷舊。一委身乃無二，豈攺適而更赴。

赴字的源字形

赴字的起名意思

意为去，往，前往，到达。

Source glyph
go
Name meaning
It means to go, go, go, arrive.
形声字。走表意,篆书形体像人迈步而行,再添上脚(止),表示奔走;ト(ba )表声,下指占卜,其形像龟甲裂纹,
“赴”取其速裂之意。本义是快走。引申为前去。
①前去:一会|~宴|~京。②在水里游:~水。
~敌 ~告 ~难~任~约~汤蹈火 ~险如夷
奔~ 分~ 开~前~后继全力以~
赴
fù
む|赴赴
“楷
Пиктофонетические символы.
Чтобы выразить смысл, сценарий печати выглядит как человек, идущий, добавляя ноги (стоп), чтобы указать на бег; ト (ba) выражает звук, нижний относится к гаданию, его изображение похоже на трещину в панцире черепахи и "идущий" принимает значение быстрого растрескивания.
Первоначальное значение - идти быстро.
Расширение должно идти.
①Иди: Ихуэй | ~ банкет | ~ Цзин.
② Плавать в воде: ~ вода.
~ враг ~ суть ~ трудный ~ любой ~ о ~ уничтожение огнем ~ столь же опасно, как и варварское
Беги ~ Разделяй ~ Открыть ~ До ~ Следуя изо всех сил ~
идти
む | Перейти к
"Кай
fù
гл.
1) поехать в...; отправиться, пойти
赴京 отправиться (поехать) в столицу
赴乡 поехать в деревню
2) броситься, устремиться
赴海 броситься в море
电赴 устремиться с быстротою молнии
3) отдавать все силы (чему-л.); трудиться во имя (чего-л.); не щадя сил работать (в данной области)
赴礼 полностью обеспечить правила поведения
赴时 изо всех сил делать всё вовремя
4) извещать о смерти (родственника); объявлять траур (по умершему члену семьи)
赴于某人 послать уведомление о смерти такому-то
赴闻 траурное извещение
Radicals: 走, ト  (run, toe)
Meaning Mnemonic
You need to run on your toes if you want to proceed down this road. If you can't run on your toes, well then you're out of luck, and you won't be able to move on at all. I didn't make this rule, I just enforce it. Now run!
Imagine trying to proceed down the road by running on your toes. No other part of your foot can touch the ground!
Reading Mnemonic
If you find that you can't proceed, you're a fool (ふ). Everyone can run on their toes. Don't you know that? No? Then you're an even bigger fool, now get outta here!
Imagine being called a fool when you can't proceed along the road because running on your toes ends up being super hard to do.
